member.name: T:WJ.MPR.Util.Settings
member.summary:
Read and write settings to an XML .config file. Does not use ConfigurationSettings.AppSettings since it's not supported on .NET Compact Framework.
Uses same schema as app.config file. Example:
NOTE: [] in example stand for less than and greater than signs in real XML...
[configuration] [appSettings] [add key="Name" value="Live Oak" /] [add key="LogEvents" value="True" /] [/appSettings] [/configuration]
Default settings file name is the same as app.config, appends .config to the end of the assembly name. Example:
{appname.exe}.config

member.name: T:WJ.MPR.Reader.MPRReader
member.summary: This is the main class instantiated by Applications. - Manages a single WJ Multi-Protocol Reader. - Provides properties and methods for accessing features of the MPR. - Talks to the MPR via an MPRComm object. - Generates request frame payloads for MPR API commands. - Parses response frame payloads from MPR API commands. - Fires events when MPR public properties change - Manages an Inventory of Tags in the MPRs field of view. - Inventory can consist of Class 0 or Class 1 tags. - Periodically polls the MPR for its current Inventory to: 1) add new tags when found 2) expire old tags - Old Tags are expired if they have not been seen for at least "PersistTime" - InventoryUpdateGap is how long to wait between inventory requests to the MPR. - Has methods to enable bootloading new FW to the MPR. - Exposes MPR methods to Read/Program/Erase/Kill/Lock Tags.

member.name: F:WJ.MPR.Reader.Inventory.persistTime
member.summary: The length of time that a RFIDTag can live in an inventory, without being reread, before it is removed by ExpireTags(). If persistTime == TimeSpan.MaxValue, then RFIDTags are never removed.

member.name: M:WJ.MPR.Reader.Inventory.ExpireTags(System.DateTime)
member.summary: The LastRead property of each RFIDTag in this Inventory + the persistTime is compared against the "now" parameter. If the sum is less, then the RFIDTag is removed from this Inventory. If persistTime == TimeSpan.MaxValue, then RFIDTags are never removed.

member.name: T:WJ.MPR.Reader.MPRFrame
member.summary:
The basic unit of communications between the host and the MPR.
Request Frames are sent from Host to MPR, and Response Frames are received by the Host from the MPR.
Both Types of frames have a similar format:
[SOF][Payload] [SOF] = 0x01
For Request Frames: [Payload] = [NodeAddress][Length][Command][Data][CRC]
For Response Frames: [Payload] = [NodeAddress][Length][Status][Data][CRC]

member.name: M:WJ.MPR.Reader.MPRFrame.ToHexString
member.summary: Converts the Frame to a string of Hexadecimal digits
member.returns: string of HEX digits

member.summary: Converts the Frame to an array of bytes
member.returns: the bytes in the Frame

member.name: F:WJ.MPR.Reader.MPRFrame.inFrame
member.summary: Bytes are ignored (inFrame = false) until a SOF byte received then bytes are stored (inFrame = true)

member.name: F:WJ.MPR.Reader.MPRFrame.CompleteFrame
member.summary: bytes are added (CompleteFrame = false), until a complete frame has been received (Count = Length + 1) and can be processed. (CompleteFrame = true)

member.name: F:WJ.MPR.Reader.MPRFrame.Processed
member.summary: After a Complete Frame has been received it is processed. After processing, Processed is set to true

member.name: M:WJ.MPR.Reader.MPRFrame.Add(System.Byte)
member.summary: Add a byte to the frame. bytes are ignored until SOF = true. when Count == Length + 1, A complete Frame has been received and is ready for processing
member.param: the byte to add

member.name: T:WJ.MPR.WinAPI.Registry
member.summary: Supplies the base RegistryKeys that access values and subkeys in the registry.
member.remarks:
This class provides the set of standard root keys found in the registry on machines running Windows CE. The registry is a storage facility for information about applications and default system settings. For example, applications can use the registry for storing information that needs to be preserved once the application is closed, and access that same information when the application is reloaded. For instance, you can store color preferences, screen locations, or the size of the window. The keys exposed by Registry are:
CurrentUser Stores information about user preferences.
LocalMachine Stores configuration information for the local machine.
ClassesRoot Stores information about types (and classes) and their properties.
Users Stores information about the default user configuration. Once you have identified the root key under which you want to store/retrieve information from the registry, you can use the RegistryKey class to add or remove subkeys, and manipulate the values for a given key.

member.name: F:WJ.MPR.WinAPI.Registry.LocalMachine

member.summary: Contains information about the current user preferences. This field reads the Windows registry base key HKEY_CURRENT_USER.

member.summary: Defines the types (or classes) of documents and the properties associated with those types. This field reads the Windows registry base key HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT.

member.name: F:WJ.MPR.WinAPI.Registry.Users
member.summary: Contains information about the default user configuration. This field reads the Windows registry base key HKEY_USERS.

member.exception: The RegistryKey being manipulated is closed (closed keys cannot be accessed).

member.name: M:WJ.MPR.WinAPI.RegistryKey.Flush
member.summary: Writes all the attributes of the specified open registry key into the registry.
member.remarks: The Flush method may also write out parts of or all of the other keys. Calling this function excessively can have a negative effect on an applications performance.

member.name: M:WJ.MPR.WinAPI.RegistryKey.Close
member.summary: Closes the key and flushes it to storage if the contents have been modified.
member.remarks: Calling this method on system keys will have no effect, since system keys should never be closed. This method does nothing if you call it on an instance of RegistryKey that is already closed.

member.summary: Specifies if the communications driver is sensitive to the state of the DSR signal. If this member is TRUE, the driver ignores any bytes received, unless the DSR modem input line is high.

member.name: F:WJ.Serial.DetailedPortSettings.TxContinueOnXOff
member.summary: Specifies if transmission stops when the input buffer is full and the driver has transmitted the XoffChar character. If this member is TRUE, transmission continues after the input buffer has come within XoffLim bytes of being full and the driver has transmitted the XoffChar character to stop receiving bytes. If this member is FALSE, transmission does not continue until the input buffer is within XonLim bytes of being empty and the driver has transmitted the XonChar character to resume reception.

member.name: F:WJ.Serial.DetailedPortSettings.OutX
member.summary: Specifies if XON/XOFF flow control is used during transmission. If this member is TRUE, transmission stops when the XoffChar character is received and starts again when the XonChar character is received.

member.name: F:WJ.Serial.DetailedPortSettings.InX
member.summary: Specifies if XON/XOFF flow control is used during reception. If this member is TRUE, the XoffChar character is sent when the input buffer comes within XoffLim bytes of being full, and the XonChar character is sent when the input buffer comes within XonLim bytes of being empty

member.name: F:WJ.Serial.DetailedPortSettings.ReplaceErrorChar
member.summary: Specifies if bytes received with parity errors are replaced with the character specified by the ErrorChar member. If this member is TRUE and the fParity member is TRUE, replacement occurs.

member.name: F:WJ.Serial.DetailedPortSettings.RTSControl
member.summary: Specifies the RTS (request-to-send) flow control. If this value is zero, the default is RTS_CONTROL_HANDSHAKE. The following table shows possible values for this member.

member.name: F:WJ.Serial.DetailedPortSettings.DiscardNulls
member.summary: Specifies if null bytes are discarded. If this member is TRUE, null bytes are discarded when received.

member.name: F:WJ.Serial.DetailedPortSettings.AbortOnError
member.summary: Specifies if read and write operations are terminated if an error occurs. If this member is TRUE, the driver terminates all read and write operations with an error status if an error occurs. The driver will not accept any further communications operations until the application has acknowledged the error by calling the ClearError function.

member.name: F:WJ.Serial.DetailedPortSettings.XonChar
member.summary: Specifies the value of the XON character for both transmission and reception

member.name: F:WJ.Serial.DetailedPortSettings.XoffChar
member.summary: Specifies the value of the XOFF character for both transmission and reception.

member.name: F:WJ.Serial.DetailedPortSettings.ErrorChar
member.summary: Specifies the value of the character used to replace bytes received with a parity error.

member.name: F:WJ.Serial.DetailedPortSettings.EOFChar
member.summary: Specifies the value of the character used to signal the end of data.

member.name: F:WJ.Serial.DetailedPortSettings.EVTChar
member.summary: Specifies the value of the character used to signal an event.

member.name: T:WJ.MPR.Reader.ZumaRow
member.summary:
A class for a single row of data in a Zuma (Impinj Class 0 Re-writeable) Tag. Each row has 18 bits, 0-17, left justified in three bytes. (only bits 0 and 1 of MSB used) There are 16 rows in a Zuma tag. Row # Function 0 Fab Protect 1 Control Word 2..3 Kill Passcode 4..N EPC Data N+1 EPC CRC N+2..15 User Data
EPC length N 64 7 96 9 128 11
Includes methods to initialize a ZumaRow object as the correct type of row.

member.name: F:WJ.MPR.Reader.ZumaRow.RowNumber
member.summary: Row Number, 0-15, of this row of the Zuma Tag.

member.name: F:WJ.MPR.Reader.ZumaRow.Byte0
member.summary: The MSB, consisting of only 2 bits (17 and 16), of the Row.

member.name: F:WJ.MPR.Reader.ZumaRow.Byte1
member.summary: Bits 15-8 of the Row.

member.name: F:WJ.MPR.Reader.ZumaRow.Byte2
member.summary: Bits 7-0 of the Row.

member.name: M:WJ.MPR.Reader.ZumaRow.EPCRow(System.Byte,System.Byte,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Fills this Row's bits with EPC data.
member.param: The MSB of the EPC data for this Row.
The LSB of the EPC data for this Row.
Whether this row is locked or not (bit17).

member.name: M:WJ.MPR.Reader.ZumaRow.PassCodeRow(System.UInt16,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Fill the Row's bits with half a Kill PassCode (12 bits).
member.param: Half a Kill PassCode (12-bits).
Whether this row is locked or not (bit 17).

member.name: M:WJ.MPR.Reader.ZumaRow.FabProtect(System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: If Clear == true, fill the Fab Protect bits with 0x0000, else fill it with the Golden Word = 0x997A. Always Row 0.
member.param: Whether to clear this row, or fill it with the Golden Word.
Whether this row is locked.

member.name: M:WJ.MPR.Reader.ZumaRow.ControlWord(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Fill the Row's bits with the proper values for a given EPC length (in bytes).
member.param: Length of the EPC, in bytes: [8, 12, or 16].
Whether this row is locked.
member.returns: true if Length is Valid; otherwise false.

member.name: M:WJ.MPR.Reader.ZumaRow.UserData(System.Byte,System.Byte,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Fill the Row with 16 bits of user data. bit 16 can be used as a WriteFlag. bit 17 is the lock bit for this row.
member.param: Most Significant 8 bits of the user data in this row.
Least Significant 8 bits of the user data in this row.
Can be used to signify that this row has been written.
Whether this row is locked.

member.name: M:WJ.MPR.Reader.ZumaRow.#ctor(System.Byte)
member.summary: Construct a Zuma Row, with just a RowNumber
member.param: The Row Number (0-15).

member.summary: Construct a Zuma Row with given its 3 bytes of data.
member.param: The Row Number (0-15).
Bits 16-17.
Bits 8-15.
Bits 0-7.

member.name: F:WJ.Serial.CommEscapes.SETBREAK
member.summary: Suspends character transmission and places the transmission line in a break state until the ClearCommBreak function is called (or EscapeCommFunction is called with the CLRBREAK extended function code). The SETBREAK extended function code is identical to the SetCommBreak function. This extended function does not flush data that has not been transmitted.

member.name: F:WJ.Serial.CommEscapes.CLRBREAK
member.summary: Restores character transmission and places the transmission line in a nonbreak state. The CLRBREAK extended function code is identical to the ClearCommBreak function

member.name: T:WJ.MPR.Util.ControlInvoker
member.summary: Control.Invoke allows a method to be invoked on the same thread as the one the control was created on. Unlike in the full .NET Framework, the .NET Compact Framework does not support the Control.Invoke overload for passing an array of objects to pass as arguments. This ControlInvoker class overcomes this limitation.

member.name: T:WJ.MPR.Reader.MPRMsg
member.summary: The Message class bundles a host-to-reader request and the reader-to-host responses for a single command exchange. - The Request Frame is stored as an MPRFrame, txFrame. - The Response Frames are stored as an MPRFrameList, rxFrames. - Stores various forms of Status Information - MPR API status or errors - Serial Communications errors - Message Timeouts - Does the work of waiting for a single "Complete" Request Frame to arrive. - The .Receive method is where the thread blocks while waiting for the serial port thread to wake it up via one of three methods: 1) .AddRxFrame() 2) .CommError() 3) .Timeout()

member.name: F:WJ.MPR.Reader.MPRMsg.MsgRcvd
member.summary: A synchronization variable for signalling the end of response frame reception, either due to an error, a timeout, or the correct number of bytes received.

The parameters of the Request Frame.

member.name: M:WJ.MPR.Reader.MPRMsg.Receive
member.summary: Response Frame Receiver. Waits on an AutoResetEvent until the end of a response frame reception. - This can be either successfull completion of a frame. - A Timeout while waiting for a response that never arrives. - A communications error. If not an error, Process each received frame: if CRC errors return RspStatus.ErrorComm if StatusCode.Complete Add rxFrame.Data to databytes return RspStatus.OK if StatusCode.Error record error return RspStatus.ErrorRsp if StatusCode.InProgress Add rxFrame.Data to databytes and keep looking for more frames.

member.summary: The Request Frame.

member.summary: A list of Response Frames. A single response could be composed of multiple "InProgress" Frames, but always a single "Complete" Frame.

member.summary: Any ErrorCode associated with this MPRMsg. If none, then ErrorCode.NoError. ErrorCodes are returned when the Status Byte of a response Frame = StatusCode.Error (0xFF).

member.name: T:WJ.MPR.Reader.MPRComm
member.summary: Responsible for handling messages bound for the MPR over a serial port. - Manages an underlying Serial Port object - Handles Serial Port Events - Generates Request Frames and parses Response Frames, and stores all frames for a single transaction in an MPRMsg. - Handles and reports Serial Port or MPR API errors. - Fires two events, 1) BLData, when data arrives (always asynchronously) from the bootloader. 2) IsOpenChanged, when the underlying serial port closes. - Performs the twiddling needed for Reseting the MPR and entering the bootloader.

member.name: M:WJ.MPR.Reader.MPRComm.ResetMPR(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Hard reboot the MPR's processor. Resetting can bring the MPR up in one of two programs. If the Bootloader line is high, we enter the bootloader. Else, the normal Application is started. The Application uses no Handshaking, 57600 baud, and communicates through MPRMsg Frames. The Bootloader uses XonXoff Handshaking, 115200 baud, and communicates through ASCII text. The two different types of message require different Message handlers (SerialPort_DataRecevied and SerialPortBL_DataRecevied).
This Method waits 100 msec after toggling the Reset Line, for the MPR to reboot.
member.param: Whether the MPR should start in the boot loader (true) or the application (false).
